text: is a small Japanese city in Gifu Prefecture on the island of Honshu. Tajimi Gifu Prefecture at JapanVisitor.com; retrieved 2013-2-21. ==History== Musō Kokushi established a Buddhist temple named Eihō-ji in 1314.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Eihō-ji" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 171. The town grew up around the temple. The modern city was founded in 1940. ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.tajimi.gifu.jp/ Category:Cities in Gifu Prefecture Category:1940 establishments in Asia Category:1940s establishments in Japan
title: Tajimi
